Class BorderCity

  • java.lang.Object
    • City
      • BorderCity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<City>

    public class BorderCity
extends City
    Represents a city that borders another country. Arriving at this city from another country will require a toll.
    Version:
    25/11-2018 19:00, version 1.2
    Author:
    Steffen W. Christensen

    • Constructor Detail

      • BorderCity

        public BorderCity(java.lang.String name,
                  int value,
                  Country country)
        Constructor for the BorderCity object. Uses the parameters to send to the superclass.
        Parameters:
        name - The City's name.
        value - The City's current and total value.
        country - The Country the City is currently residing in.

    • Method Detail

      • arrive

        public int arrive(Player p)
        Gets the superclass' arrive method, then checks if the player is entering from a different country than this city is located in. If they are, calculate a toll based on the settings and remove that from the bonus. Add the toll to the city's value.
        Overrides:
        arrive in class City
        Returns:
        The bonus(-toll) for arriving in the current City.
